| dykdate = 2 January 2009 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WPMILHIST|class=A|Maritime=y|WWII=y|A-Class=pass}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=A}} {{WikiProject United States|class=A|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Transport|class=A|importance=Mid|maritime=y|maritime-importance=Mid}} }}
==Damaged by a rocket? December 1944, Atlantic == Was it a V-rocket hit on a port or - what could it be ? I suspect that by December 1944 the Germans already lost all air-to-ship capabilities. [[User:NVO|NVO]] ([[User talk:NVO|talk]]) 20:17, 23 December 2008 (UTC) :It was a [[V-2]]. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 08:05, 25 December 2008 (UTC)
==Unneeded sections?== It is not clear what the ''Memorial'' section adds. This vessel was not built in Oregon, and a description of the memorial park would be more apropos in an article on the park, rather than in each article on a Liberty ship. A separate article on the park, linked here to a simple statement that this vessel's bow is buried there, would be a better way to handle it. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 20:15, 26 December 2008 (UTC) :It seems the park has fallen victim to development.[http://www.indiodesign.com/libertyshippark/] [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 20:57, 26 December 2008 (UTC)
::I have deleted the section entitled ''Official number and code letters'' as the infobox now contains that information, and the data seemed too specialized to need repetition in the text. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 23:37, 26 December 2008 (UTC)
With the recent changes to the article these concerns can be marked '''Resolved'''. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 15:42, 29 December 2008 (UTC)
==Measurements== I notice that the measurements of the ship given in the article no longer match the source I used when I added them. [http://www.plimsollshipdata.org/pdffile.php?name=45a1033.pdf Lloyd's Register] gives:- length {{convert|422|ft|8|in|m|2}}, beam {{convert|57|ft|m|2}} and draught {{convert|34|ft|8|in|m|2}}; whereas the article now states it as:- length {{convert|441|ft|6|in|m|2}}, beam {{convert|56|ft|10.75|in|m|2}} and draught {{convert|34|ft|8|in|m|2}}. I would have thought that the measurements given by Lloyd's were accurate, as they would have been taken when the ship was entered on the register. [[User:Mjroots|Mjroots]] ([[User talk:Mjroots|talk]]) 07:59, 30 December 2008 (UTC)
:There are different measures of length. See [[Hull_(watercraft)#Metrics]]. [http://www.oakgrovedesigns.net/homepage/libships/details.html This website] gives dimensions of the type as 417’8” LBP, 427’ LWL, and 441’6” LOA. Still not the same as Lloyd's. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 14:45, 30 December 2008 (UTC) :And [http://www.miramarshipindex.org.nz/ship/show/135792 Miramar]'s figures convert to 416' LBP, and 441.6' LOA. It would be interesting to know what load assumptions are made to determine the nominal LWL, as the [[Length at the waterline|waterline length]] would depend on how deeply the vessel is riding. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 18:46, 30 December 2008 (UTC)
::[http://www.pmars.imsg.com/DisposalCard/All/4879_AF.jpg This custody card] (cited in present fn 3) also gives the 417'8" length, which is the same figure for LBP (length between perpendiculars). Figures for net and DWT are also on that card. [[User:Kablammo|Kablammo]] ([[User talk:Kablammo|talk]]) 15:24, 1 January 2009 (UTC)
== External link removal == I removed the only external link listed in the article because it was not suitable for this article (per [[WP:ELNO]], item 13) — [[User:Bellhalla|Bellhalla]] ([[User talk:Bellhalla|talk]]) 15:02, 2 January 2009 (UTC)
== Another ship == Thanks for all the interest in tidying this article; if any of you have time & resources, I'd suggest looking at the [[SS John Stagg]] as well. Cheers! [[User:PapaSmirk|Tad]] ([[User talk:PapaSmirk|talk]]) 22:12, 10 January 2009 (UTC)
